reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is adequate. We stayed for 5 nights in a double room with small balcony facing the street. The balcony was nice as it provided some fresh air and street view in the mornings.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: The room is quite small, there is literally room for just a double bed and small table. The bed is comfortable and the tv has pay tv english channels. There is also air-conditioning.
reviews.title: Nothing special- friendly staff, good location- bad breakfast

likes.liked: — Location was very good- the staff was friendly
likes.disliked: — Found the billing deceptive, poor breakfast offered, hotel lacks charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom is adequate but only soap is provided. There is a hair dryer.
reviews.title: Great hotel
Charming Hotel in Great Location!
reviews.text: The breakfast consists of croissant and baguette, juice, tea/coffee/hot chocolate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located about 4 blocks from the main street (Saint Michel) and is also very close to Cardinal Lemoine metro station. The website says it's 2 minutes walk from Saint Michel metro station but that's not true - it's about 6 blocks so up to 20 minutes.
reviews.title: Good value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very close to the Notre Dame and Pantheon. Bus that goes directly to the Eiffel Tower is just down the road. Metro is also very close. We had the balcony room which was really nice. The pillow was really one long skinny pillow for a double bed and the toilet was a little yellow (old) but it was clean. Breakfast wasn't the best - the baguette was stale every morning but the hot chocolate was really nice! Overall, it was a good hotel for a good price in a reasonably good location - especially for high season!
reviews.title: Cute little balcony

reviews.text: We loved our time at the Familia. This is a super little hotel and the location is great for getting around Paris.
reviews.title: Love our stay at the Familia

reviews.text: The staff at the hotel were amazing. Marc, Edson and Laurent were all incredibly friendly and helpful. My husband practiced his French with them but all spoke English very, very well.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our rooms were also very nice. We were on the 6th floor and our cousins were on the 4th floor. We had a small balcony which you could step out on and see the towers of Notre Dame. Ahh Paris.
reviews.title: Hotel Familia gets the job done

likes.liked: — Great location and pretty responsive staff
likes.disliked: — The room is compact, but, hey, that's Paris.

reviews.text: The rooms are not huge but were larger then the rooms in hotel we stayed in a number of weeks prior to this and the bathooms were clean and spacious enough to set out your required toiletrees.
reviews.title: Good hotel, tragic mould problem
Friendly staff
reviews.text: We (myself, husband and 1-yr old daughter) stayed here for our last night in France, with an early morning flight to catch at CDG the following morning. Location is great (5th), and is in walking distance from Ile de la Cite, Jardin du Luxembourg, and of course all the Latin Quarter has to offer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made our reservations 2 months in advance, completely by email, for a double bed with balcony and shower, and received confirmation right away. We confirmed our arrival time the night before arriving, and again we received confirmation right away.
reviews.title: wouldn't recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Their reception is extremely friendly, patient with my beginners' French, and fluent in English. We did indeed receive the double room with balcony and shower. The rooms are tiny, as are most Parisian hotel rooms, but also clean and comfortable. Our bathroom had obviously been recently redone as it was shiny and spotless, though small as well. The balcony was small, but did fit a bistro table and 2 chairs, which was wonderful for watching the world go by while dining on takeaway at midnight.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception arranged our (shared) ride to the airport, as well as arranging for an early breakfast for us. Although breakfast was normally served 7am onwards, we were served promptly at 5:45 am as requested, before our 6 am pick-up.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

likes.liked: — location, walking distance to Notre Dame

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you need a clean, comfortable room in which to crash at the end of a long day, this is decently priced for the area. If you're into luxurious hotel ambience, room service, etc, this is not for you. Their service was wonderful, as is the location, and is overall a charming hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel
Loved the Familia!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Familia Hotel in June, 2007, I did a research on the internet, and found out great opinions for this hotel, this is not very expensive, and has a great location. The rooms are very comfortable, with air conditioning, a plasma T.V., nice view, and sound proof windows, I didn`t hear a sound at nigth when I wanted to sleep. The bathroom is very little but I have seen worse. For the price, we think is a really nice choice, no other hotel can do better in the Latin Quarter than the Familia Hotel. They have a very, very little elevator , but with room enough for 2 people and our suitcases, and If you don`t want the crowed dining room downstairs inthe morning, the breakfast can be served at your room at your request. As I am telling you, the staff is very friendly, and that was very important for us, because we only speak spanish or english.For the metro, you have 2 stations nearby.You can shop for groceries in the same street, or have dinner in one of the restaurants in the zone: french cuisine, etiopian, chinese, cuban cuisine, international.Next time in Paris, I will stay at the same hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here after we took the EuroStar from London, which in itself was AWESOME!! The hotel is very beautiful and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The rates are inexpensive and include breakfast. Even though we were offered breakfast everyday and booked the room knowing that it inclluded breakfast, since we chose not to have it we were not charged!
reviews.title: A great inexpensive hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stow away all your fears of the French being rude we did not meet one rude person our entire stay. We were given great recommendations for restaurants. The room was small but tastfuly decorated and the bathroom was very clean. Paris is such a breathtaking city, I couldn't belive that I would love it so, we can hardly wait to return.
reviews.title: Terrific Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the La Famillia for 5 nights and it was great. The hotel is located in a perfect place - 10 minutes walking from the Notre Dam and the Ile Saint Louise, 5 minutes walking from the metro station.
reviews.title: quiet hotel in the latin quarter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean, small but very nice and romantic. Receptionist spoke English and were very friendly.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.disliked: — Nothing negative to say about it
